sentences.sContent: I’m replacing Sue on the team.
Lectures have replaced the old tutorial system.
sentences.sCn: 课堂授课取代了旧式的导师制。

sentences.sContent: ...they totally cannot replace going to school...
...high technologies cannot replace going to school at all...
...TV was supposed to replace movies but...
...others are under the impression that electronic communication can replace face-to-face contact...
...There is no consensus of opinions among people regarding whether electronic communication can replace face-to-face contact...
...I still don’t think the electronic communication can replace face-to-face contact...
...An X-rays technician is refusing to do her job until the firm agrees to replace its out-dated equipment...
...Tom does not think a babysitter can replace a mother and thinks it's a bad idea for the children to spend so much time with someone who's not part of the family...
...Most designers with existing labels are finding there aren’t comparable fabrics that can just replace what you’re doing and shat your customers are used to...

exam.question: Many in the credit industry expect that credit cards will eventually __________ paper money for almost every purchase.

answer.explain: 句意：  很多信贷业内人士都预计信用卡将最终取代纸币用于几乎所有的交易。 exchange：  交换； 兑换； 交易； reduce：  减少， 缩小； 简化； trade：  交易， 买卖。

synos.tran: 取代，代替；替换，更换；归还，偿还；把…放回原处

remMethod.val: re(重新) ＋ place(位置) → 重新定位 → 更换； 代替

words.tran: 可替换的；可置换的；可放在原处的
更换；复位；代替者；补充兵员
可替换性，替代性；置换能力

trans.tranOther: to start doing something instead of another person, or start being used instead of another thing
